tags.name: connectors
tags.description: Connector APIs enable you to create and manage connectors.

post.summary: Create a connector with a random ID
post.description: The connector identifier is randomly generated.

parameters.name: connectorId
parameters.description: A UUID v1 or v4 identifier for the connector. If you omit this parameter, an identifier is randomly generated.

post.description: You can use this API to test an action that involves interaction with Kibana services or integrations with third-party systems. You must have `read` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges. If you use an index connector, you must also have `all`, `create`, `index`, or `write` indices privileges.

oneOf.description: An array of information returned from the action.

parameters.name: feature_id
parameters.description: A filter to limit the retrieved connector types to those that support a specific feature (such as alerting or cases).

schema.title: Get connector types response body properties
schema.description: The properties vary for each connector type.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in Kibana.

enabled_in_config.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in the Kibana configuration file.

enabled_in_license.description: Indicates whether the connector is enabled in the license.

minimum_license_required.description: The license that is required to use the connector type.

name.description: The name of the connector type.

supported_feature_ids.description: The features that are supported by the connector type.

delete.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the delete connector API instead. WARNING: When you delete a connector, it cannot be recovered.

get.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the get connector API instead.

put.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the update connector API instead.

schema.title: Legacy update connector request body properties
schema.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

config.description: The new connector configuration. Configuration properties vary depending on the connector type.

name.description: The new name for the connector.

secrets.description: The updated secrets configuration for the connector. Secrets properties vary depending on the connector type.

get.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the get all connectors API instead.

post.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the create connector API instead.

config.description: The configuration for the connector. Configuration properties vary depending on the connector type.

name.description: The display name for the connector.

secrets.description: The secrets configuration for the connector. Secrets configuration properties vary depending on the connector type. NOTE: Remember these values. You must provide them each time you update the connector.

get.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the get all connector types API instead.

schema.title: Legacy get connector types response body properties
schema.description: The properties vary for each connector type.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in Kibana.

enabledInConfig.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in the Kibana `.yml` file.

enabledInLicense.description: Indicates whether the connector is enabled in the license.

id.description: The unique identifier for the connector type.

minimumLicenseRequired.description: The license that is required to use the connector type.

name.description: The name of the connector type.

post.description: Deprecated in 7.13.0. Use the run connector API instead.

schema.title: Legacy run connector request body properties
schema.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

params.description: The parameters of the connector. Parameter properties vary depending on the connector type.

oneOf.description: An array of information returned from the action.

config_properties_bedrock.title: Connector request properties for an Amazon Bedrock connector
config_properties_bedrock.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.bedrock`.

defaultModel.description: The generative artificial intelligence model for Amazon Bedrock to use. Current support is for the Anthropic Claude models.

secrets_properties_bedrock.title: Connector secrets properties for an Amazon Bedrock connector
secrets_properties_bedrock.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.bedrock`.

accessKey.description: The AWS access key for authentication.

config_properties_gemini.title: Connector request properties for an Google Gemini connector
config_properties_gemini.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.gemini`.

defaultModel.description: The generative artificial intelligence model for Google Gemini to use.

gcpRegion.description: The GCP region where the Vertex AI endpoint enabled.

gcpProjectID.description: The Google ProjectID that has Vertex AI endpoint enabled.

secrets_properties_gemini.title: Connector secrets properties for a Google Gemini connector
secrets_properties_gemini.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.gemini`.

credentialsJSON.description: The service account credentials JSON file. The service account should have Vertex AI user IAM role assigned to it.

config_properties_cases_webhook.title: Connector request properties for Webhook - Case Management connector
config_properties_cases_webhook.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.cases-webhook`.

createCommentJson.description: A JSON payload sent to the create comment URL to create a case comment. You can use variables to add Kibana Cases data to the payload. The required variable is `case.comment`. Due to Mustache template variables (the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated once the Mustache variables have been placed when the REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid, disregarding the Mustache variables, so the later validation will pass.

createCommentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to create a case comment in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

createCommentUrl.description: The REST API URL to create a case comment by ID in the third-party system. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts setting`, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

createIncidentJson.description: A JSON payload sent to the create case URL to create a case. You can use variables to add case data to the payload. Required variables are `case.title` and `case.description`. Due to Mustache template variables (which is the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid to avoid future validation errors; disregard Mustache variables during your review.

createIncidentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to create a case in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

createIncidentResponseKey.description: The JSON key in the create external case response that contains the case ID.

createIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to create a case in the third-party system. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

getIncidentResponseExternalTitleKey.description: The JSON key in get external case response that contains the case title.

getIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to get the case by ID from the third-party system. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. Due to Mustache template variables (the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid, disregarding the Mustache variables, so the later validation will pass.

hasAuth.description: If true, a username and password for login type authentication must be provided.

headers.description: A set of key-value pairs sent as headers with the request URLs for the create case, update case, get case, and create comment methods.

updateIncidentJson.description: The JSON payload sent to the update case URL to update the case. You can use variables to add Kibana Cases data to the payload. Required variables are `case.title` and `case.description`. Due to Mustache template variables (which is the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid to avoid future validation errors; disregard Mustache variables during your review.

updateIncidentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to update the case in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

updateIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to update the case by ID in the third-party system. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

viewIncidentUrl.description: The URL to view the case in the external system. You can use variables to add the external system ID or external system title to the URL.

secrets_properties_cases_webhook.title: Connector secrets properties for Webhook - Case Management connector

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

user.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

config_properties_d3security.title: Connector request properties for a D3 Security connector
config_properties_d3security.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.d3security`.

url.description: The D3 Security API request URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

secrets_properties_d3security.title: Connector secrets properties for a D3 Security connector
secrets_properties_d3security.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.d3security`.

config_properties_email.title: Connector request properties for an email connector
config_properties_email.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.email`.

clientId.description: The client identifier, which is a part of OAuth 2.0 client credentials authentication, in GUID format. If `service` is `exchange_server`, this property is required.

from.description: The from address for all emails sent by the connector. It must be specified in `user@host-name` format.

hasAuth.description: Specifies whether a user and password are required inside the secrets configuration.

host.description: The host name of the service provider. If the `service` is `elastic_cloud` (for Elastic Cloud notifications) or one of Nodemailer's well-known email service providers, this property is ignored. If `service` is `other`, this property must be defined.

port.description: The port to connect to on the service provider. If the `service` is `elastic_cloud` (for Elastic Cloud notifications) or one of Nodemailer's well-known email service providers, this property is ignored. If `service` is `other`, this property must be defined.

secure.description: Specifies whether the connection to the service provider will use TLS. If the `service` is `elastic_cloud` (for Elastic Cloud notifications) or one of Nodemailer's well-known email service providers, this property is ignored.

service.description: The name of the email service.

tenantId.description: The tenant identifier, which is part of OAuth 2.0 client credentials authentication, in GUID format. If `service` is `exchange_server`, this property is required.

secrets_properties_email.title: Connector secrets properties for an email connector
secrets_properties_email.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.email`.

clientSecret.description: The Microsoft Exchange Client secret for OAuth 2.0 client credentials authentication. It must be URL-encoded. If `service` is `exchange_server`, this property is required.

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

user.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

config_properties_genai_azure.title: Connector request properties for an OpenAI connector that uses Azure OpenAI
config_properties_genai_azure.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.gen-ai` and the API provider is `Azure OpenAI'.

config_properties_genai_openai.title: Connector request properties for an OpenAI connector
config_properties_genai_openai.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.gen-ai` and the API provider is `OpenAI'.

defaultModel.description: The default model to use for requests.

config_properties_genai.title: Connector request properties for an OpenAI connector
config_properties_genai.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.gen-ai`.

secrets_properties_genai.title: Connector secrets properties for an OpenAI connector
secrets_properties_genai.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.gen-ai`.

config_properties_index.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.index`.

index.description: The Elasticsearch index to be written to.

refresh.description: The refresh policy for the write request, which affects when changes are made visible to search. Refer to the refresh setting for Elasticsearch document APIs.

config_properties_jira.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.jira`.

secrets_properties_resilient.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.resilient`.

apiKeySecret.description: The authentication key secret for HTTP Basic authentication.

config_properties_sentinelone.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.sentinelone`.

url.description: The SentinelOne tenant URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

secrets_properties_sentinelone.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.sentinelone`.

config_properties_servicenow.title: Connector request properties for a ServiceNow ITSM connector
config_properties_servicenow.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.servicenow`.

clientId.description: The client ID assigned to your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

isOAuth.description: The type of authentication to use. The default value is false, which means basic authentication is used instead of open authorization (OAuth).

jwtKeyId.description: The key identifier assigned to the JWT verifier map of your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

userIdentifierValue.description: The identifier to use for OAuth authentication. This identifier should be the user field you selected when you created an OAuth JWT API endpoint for external clients in your ServiceNow instance. For example, if the selected user field is `Email`, the user identifier should be the user's email address. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

usesTableApi.description: Determines whether the connector uses the Table API or the Import Set API. This property is supported only for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.  NOTE: If this property is set to `false`, the Elastic application should be installed in ServiceNow.

secrets_properties_servicenow.title: Connector secrets properties for ServiceNow ITOM, ServiceNow ITSM, and ServiceNow SecOps connectors
secrets_properties_servicenow.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.servicenow`, `.servicenow-sir`, or `.servicenow-itom`.

clientSecret.description: The client secret assigned to your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `false`.

privateKey.description: The RSA private key that you created for use in ServiceNow. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

privateKeyPassword.description: The password for the RSA private key. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true` and you set a password on your private key.

username.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `false`.

config_properties_servicenow_itom.title: Connector request properties for a ServiceNow ITSM connector
config_properties_servicenow_itom.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.servicenow`.

clientId.description: The client ID assigned to your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

isOAuth.description: The type of authentication to use. The default value is false, which means basic authentication is used instead of open authorization (OAuth).

jwtKeyId.description: The key identifier assigned to the JWT verifier map of your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

userIdentifierValue.description: The identifier to use for OAuth authentication. This identifier should be the user field you selected when you created an OAuth JWT API endpoint for external clients in your ServiceNow instance. For example, if the selected user field is `Email`, the user identifier should be the user's email address. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

config_properties_tines.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.tines`.

config_properties_torq.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.torq`.

webhookIntegrationUrl.description: The endpoint URL of the Elastic Security integration in Torq.

secrets_properties_torq.title: Connector secrets properties for a Torq connector
secrets_properties_torq.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.torq`.

token.description: The secret of the webhook authentication header.

config_properties_webhook.title: Connector request properties for a Webhook connector
config_properties_webhook.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.webhook`.

authType.description: The type of authentication to use: basic, SSL, or none.

ca.description: A base64 encoded version of the certificate authority file that the connector can trust to sign and validate certificates. This option is available for all authentication types.

certType.description: If the `authType` is `webhook-authentication-ssl`, specifies whether the certificate authentication data is in a CRT and key file format or a PFX file format.

hasAuth.description: If `true`, a user name and password must be provided for login type authentication.

headers.description: A set of key-value pairs sent as headers with the request.

method.description: The HTTP request method, either `post` or `put`.

url.description: The request URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

verificationMode.description: Controls the verification of certificates. Use `full` to validate that the certificate has an issue date within the `not_before` and `not_after` dates, chains to a trusted certificate authority (CA), and has a hostname or IP address that matches the names within the certificate. Use `certificate` to validate the certificate and verify that it is signed by a trusted authority; this option does not check the certificate hostname. Use `none` to skip certificate validation.

secrets_properties_webhook.title: Connector secrets properties for a Webhook connector
secrets_properties_webhook.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.webhook`.

crt.description: If `authType` is `webhook-authentication-ssl` and `certType` is `ssl-crt-key`, it is a base64 encoded version of the CRT or CERT file.

key.description: If `authType` is `webhook-authentication-ssl` and `certType` is `ssl-crt-key`, it is a base64 encoded version of the KEY file.

pfx.description: If `authType` is `webhook-authentication-ssl` and `certType` is `ssl-pfx`, it is a base64 encoded version of the PFX or P12 file.

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication or the passphrase for the SSL certificate files. If `hasAuth` is set to `true` and `authType` is `webhook-authentication-basic`, this property is required.

user.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`  and `authType` is `webhook-authentication-basic`, this property is required.

config_properties_xmatters.title: Connector request properties for an xMatters connector
config_properties_xmatters.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.xmatters`.

configUrl.description: The request URL for the Elastic Alerts trigger in xMatters. It is applicable only when `usesBasic` is `true`.

usesBasic.description: Specifies whether the connector uses HTTP basic authentication (`true`) or URL authentication (`false`).

secrets_properties_xmatters.title: Connector secrets properties for an xMatters connector
secrets_properties_xmatters.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.xmatters`.

password.description: A user name for HTTP basic authentication. It is applicable only when `usesBasic` is `true`.

secretsUrl.description: The request URL for the Elastic Alerts trigger in xMatters with the API key included in the URL. It is applicable only when `usesBasic` is `false`.

user.description: A password for HTTP basic authentication. It is applicable only when `usesBasic` is `true`.

is_deprecated.description: Indicates whether the connector type is deprecated.

is_missing_secrets.description: Indicates whether secrets are missing for the connector. Secrets configuration properties vary depending on the connector type.

is_preconfigured.description: Indicates whether it is a preconfigured connector. If true, the `config` and `is_missing_secrets` properties are omitted from the response.

is_system_action.description: Indicates whether the connector is used for system actions.

referenced_by_count.description: Indicates the number of saved objects that reference the connector. If `is_preconfigured` is true, this value is not calculated. This property is returned only by the get all connectors API.

run_connector_params_acknowledge_resolve.title: PagerDuty connector parameters
run_connector_params_acknowledge_resolve.description: Test an action that acknowledges or resolves a PagerDuty alert.

dedupKey.description: The deduplication key for the PagerDuty alert.

run_connector_params_documents.title: Index connector parameters
run_connector_params_documents.description: Test an action that indexes a document into Elasticsearch.

documents.description: The documents in JSON format for index connectors.

run_connector_params_message_email.title: Email connector parameters
run_connector_params_message_email.description: Test an action that sends an email message. There must be at least one recipient in `to`, `cc`, or `bcc`.

bcc.description: A list of "blind carbon copy" email addresses. Addresses can be specified in `user@host-name` format or in name `<user@host-name>` format

cc.description: A list of "carbon copy" email addresses. Addresses can be specified in `user@host-name` format or in name `<user@host-name>` format

message.description: The email message text. Markdown format is supported.

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

to.description: A list of email addresses. Addresses can be specified in `user@host-name` format or in name `<user@host-name>` format.

run_connector_params_message_serverlog.title: Server log connector parameters
run_connector_params_message_serverlog.description: Test an action that writes an entry to the Kibana server log.

level.description: The log level of the message for server log connectors.

message.description: The message for server log connectors.

run_connector_params_message_slack.title: Slack connector parameters
run_connector_params_message_slack.description: Test an action that sends a message to Slack. It is applicable only when the connector type is `.slack`.

message.description: The Slack message text, which cannot contain Markdown, images, or other advanced formatting.

run_connector_params_trigger_pagerduty.title: PagerDuty connector parameters
run_connector_params_trigger_pagerduty.description: Test an action that triggers a PagerDuty alert.

class.description: The class or type of the event.

component.description: The component of the source machine that is responsible for the event.

customDetails.description: Additional details to add to the event.

dedupKey.description: All actions sharing this key will be associated with the same PagerDuty alert. This value is used to correlate trigger and resolution.

group.description: The logical grouping of components of a service.

links.description: A list of links to add to the event.

text.description: A plain text description of the purpose of the link.

severity.description: The severity of the event on the affected system.

source.description: The affected system, such as a hostname or fully qualified domain name. Defaults to the Kibana saved object id of the action.

timestamp.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp that indicates when the event was detected or generated.

run_connector_subaction_addevent.title: The addEvent subaction
run_connector_subaction_addevent.description: The `addEvent` subaction for ServiceNow ITOM connectors.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

event_class.description: A specific instance of the source.

message_key.description: All actions sharing this key are associated with the same ServiceNow alert. The default value is `<rule ID>:<alert instance ID>`.

node.description: The host that the event was triggered for.

source.description: The name of the event source type.

alias.description: The unique identifier used for alert deduplication in Opsgenie. The alias must match the value used when creating the alert.

source.description: The display name for the source of the alert.

user.description: The display name for the owner.

run_connector_subaction_closeincident.title: The closeIncident subaction
run_connector_subaction_closeincident.description: The `closeIncident` subaction for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

correlation_id.description: An identifier that is assigned to the incident when it is created by the connector. NOTE: If you use the default value and the rule generates multiple alerts that use the same alert IDs, the latest open incident for this correlation ID is closed unless you specify the external ID.

externalId.description: The unique identifier (`incidentId`) for the incident in ServiceNow.

actions.description: The custom actions available to the alert.

alias.description: The unique identifier used for alert deduplication in Opsgenie.

description.description: A description that provides detailed information about the alert.

details.description: The custom properties of the alert.

entity.description: The domain of the alert. For example, the application or server name.

priority.description: The priority level for the alert.

responders.description: The entities to receive notifications about the alert. If `type` is `user`, either `id` or `username` is required. If `type` is `team`, either `id` or `name` is required.

name.description: The name of the entity.

type.description: The type of responders, in this case `escalation`.

username.description: A valid email address for the user.

source.description: The display name for the source of the alert.

user.description: The display name for the owner.

visibleTo.description: The teams and users that the alert will be visible to without sending a notification. Only one of `id`, `name`, or `username` is required.

name.description: The name of the entity.

username.description: The user name. This property is required only when the `type` is `user`.

run_connector_subaction_getchoices.title: The getChoices subaction
run_connector_subaction_getchoices.description: The `getChoices` subaction for ServiceNow ITOM, ServiceNow ITSM, and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

run_connector_subaction_getfields.title: The getFields subaction
run_connector_subaction_getfields.description: The `getFields` subaction for Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

run_connector_subaction_getincident.title: The getIncident subaction
run_connector_subaction_getincident.description: The `getIncident` subaction for Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

externalId.description: The Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, or ServiceNow SecOps issue identifier.

title.description: The title of the Jira issue.

run_connector_subaction_pushtoservice.title: The pushToService subaction
run_connector_subaction_pushtoservice.description: The `pushToService` subaction for Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, ServiceNow SecOps, Swimlane, and Webhook - Case Management connectors.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

comments.description: Additional information that is sent to Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, ServiceNow SecOps, or Swimlane.

comment.description: A comment related to the incident. For example, describe how to troubleshoot the issue.

commentId.description: A unique identifier for the comment.

incident.description: Information necessary to create or update a Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, ServiveNow SecOps, or Swimlane incident.

alertId.description: The alert identifier for Swimlane connectors.

caseId.description: The case identifier for the incident for Swimlane connectors.

caseName.description: The case name for the incident for Swimlane connectors.

category.description: The category of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

correlation_display.description: A descriptive label of the alert for correlation purposes for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

correlation_id.description: The correlation identifier for the security incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiveNow SecOps connectors. Connectors using the same correlation ID are associated with the same ServiceNow incident. This value determines whether a new ServiceNow incident is created or an existing one is updated. Modifying this value is optional; if not modified, the rule ID and alert ID are combined as `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` to form the correlation ID value in ServiceNow. The maximum character length for this value is 100 characters. NOTE: Using the default configuration of `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` ensures that ServiceNow creates a separate incident record for every generated alert that uses a unique alert ID. If the rule generates multiple alerts that use the same alert IDs, ServiceNow creates and continually updates a single incident record for the alert.

description.description: The description of the incident for Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, ServiceNow SecOps, Swimlane, and Webhook - Case Management connectors.

dest_ip.description: A list of destination IP addresses related to the security incident for ServiceNow SecOps connectors. The IPs are added as observables to the security incident.

externalId.description: The Jira, ServiceNow ITSM, or ServiceNow SecOps issue identifier. If present, the incident is updated. Otherwise, a new incident is created.

id.description: The external case identifier for Webhook - Case Management connectors.

impact.description: The impact of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

issueType.description: The type of incident for Jira connectors. For example, 10006. To obtain the list of valid values, set `subAction` to `issueTypes`.

labels.description: The labels for the incident for Jira connectors. NOTE: Labels cannot contain spaces.

malware_hash.description: A list of malware hashes related to the security incident for ServiceNow SecOps connectors. The hashes are added as observables to the security incident.

malware_url.description: A list of malware URLs related to the security incident for ServiceNow SecOps connectors. The URLs are added as observables to the security incident.

otherFields.description: Custom field identifiers and their values for Jira connectors.

parent.description: The ID or key of the parent issue for Jira connectors. Applies only to `Sub-task` types of issues.

priority.description: The priority of the incident in Jira and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

ruleName.description: The rule name for Swimlane connectors.

severity.description: The severity of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and Swimlane connectors.

short_description.description: A short description of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors. It is used for searching the contents of the knowledge base.

source_ip.description: A list of source IP addresses related to the security incident for ServiceNow SecOps connectors. The IPs are added as observables to the security incident.

status.description: The status of the incident for Webhook - Case Management connectors.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

summary.description: A summary of the incident for Jira connectors.

tags.description: A list of tags for Webhook - Case Management connectors.

title.description: A title for the incident for Jira and Webhook - Case Management connectors. It is used for searching the contents of the knowledge base.

urgency.description: The urgency of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

run_connector_subaction_postmessage.title: The postMessage subaction
run_connector_subaction_postmessage.description: Test an action that sends a message to Slack. It is applicable only when the connector type is `.slack_api`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

channelIds.description: The Slack channel identifier, which must be one of the `allowedChannels` in the connector configuration.

channels.description: The name of a channel that your Slack app has access to.

text.description: The Slack message text. If it is a Slack webhook connector, the text cannot contain Markdown, images, or other advanced formatting. If it is a Slack web API connector, it can contain either plain text or block kit messages.

run_connector_subaction_validchannelid.title: The validChannelId subaction
run_connector_subaction_validchannelid.description: Retrieves information about a valid Slack channel identifier. It is applicable only when the connector type is `.slack_api`.

run_connector_request.title: Run connector request body properties
run_connector_request.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

oneOf.title: Subaction parameters
oneOf.description: Test an action that involves a subaction.

features.description: The feature that uses the connector.

connector_types.title: Connector types
connector_types.description: The type of connector. For example, `.email`, `.index`, `.jira`, `.opsgenie`, or `.server-log`.

action_response_properties.title: Action response properties
action_response_properties.description: The properties vary depending on the action type.

isDeprecated.description: Indicates whether the action type is deprecated.

isMissingSecrets.description: Indicates whether secrets are missing for the action.

isPreconfigured.description: Indicates whether it is a preconfigured action.

get_connector_types_generativeai_respons.summary: A list of connector types for the `generativeAI` feature.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.
